ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Demonstrates StrokeThickness, StrokeDashArray and PointMarker properties of a LineSeries which can be used to style a dashed or solid line with triangle markers
ExampleDefinition.Description:
Demonstrates the FastLineRenderableSeries [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.RenderableSeries.BaseRenderableSeries~StrokeDashArray.html']StrokeDashArray[/url], StrokeThickness and PointMarker properties which can be used to style a dashed or solid line with triangle markers.
The [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.RenderableSeries.BaseRenderableSeries~StrokeDashArray.html']StrokeDashArray property[/url] accepts a double array similar to the [url='https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb980148(v=vs.95).aspx']WPF StrokeDashArray property[/url], and defines the length and spacing of dash strokes.
[b]Documentation Links[/b]
- [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/The%20Line%20Series%20Type.html']FastLineRenderableSeries Type[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.RenderableSeries.BaseRenderableSeries~StrokeDashArray.html']StrokeDashArray Property[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/Common%20RenderableSeries%20Properties.html']Stroke and StrokeThickness[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#What%20is%20a%20RenderableSeries.html']What is a RenderableSeries and what is a DataSeries?[/url]
